Title.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of the Masimo Rad-67® Pulse CO-Oximeter® for detecting anemia in pregnant women attending antenatal care clinics in Kilifi, Kenya.

Trial_Design.evidence: A retrospective diagnostic accuracy study was conducted, nested within a prospective pregnancy cohort study.

Participants.evidence: The study included unselected pregnant women from two public hospitals in Kilifi County.

Intervention.evidence: The index test, SpHb, was compared against the reference standard, Lab Hb, measured by a SYSMEX XN-330 automated hematology analyzer.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of the Masimo Rad-67® Pulse CO-Oximeter® for detecting anemia in pregnant women attending antenatal care clinics in Kilifi, Kenya.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Records from May 2021 to December 2022 with both SpHb and Lab Hb results were analyzed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 2,975 records from 2,203 unique participants were analyzed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 2,975 records from 2,203 unique participants were analyzed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Linear regression showed a weak positive correlation with a proportional bias of 0.44 (95% CI 0.41–0.47) and a constant of 7.59 (95% CI 7.30–7.87, p < 0.001).
